definition: the Northern Expedition, the Nationalists' campaign of 1926-1928 under Chiang Kai-shek, against the rule of local warlords
north/(classical) to be defeated
to cut down/to fell/to dispatch an expedition against/to attack/to boast/Taiwan pr. [fa1]
the Northern Expeditionary Army
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters

sentences.english: And finally, someone's got to lead the battle against Arthas and his Scourge, right?
sentences.chinese: 最后，总是应该有人领导这场“北伐倒阿”战争的吧？

sentences.english: Thanks to all this and to the assistance of the Soviet Union, the Northern Expedition was victorious.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些，再由于苏联的援助，就取得了北伐的胜利。

sentences.english: Tang Sheng-chih was a general who sided with the revolution in the Northern expedition.
sentences.chinese: 唐生智是当时站在革命方面参加北伐的一个将军。

sentences.english: The northern part is suffering from drought.
sentences.chinese: 第一阶段，是参加北伐战争。

sentences.english: The war against Hou-Qin is one important step of Liu Yu's for replacing East-Jin.
sentences.chinese: 北伐后秦是刘裕完成其代晋事业采取的对外措施之一。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen and Chen Jiongming soon split over the continuation of the Northern Expedition.
sentences.chinese: 孙逸仙和陈炯明不久就因继续北伐的事宜而分道扬镳。

sentences.english: Hastily launched "the Northern Expeditionary Army had" several wars down one after another Lok Ma.
sentences.chinese: 匆匆上马的“北伐军们”几仗下来纷纷落马。

definition: punitive expedition to the south
punitive expedition to the west
punitive expedition to the east
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
punitive expedition to the north
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
the Northern Expeditionary Army
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
to go on a punitive expedition
to attack and seize
to go on or send a punitive expedition
in command of the army
Cao Wei, the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms, established as a dynasty in 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕, son of Cao Cao, replaced by Jin dynasty in 265
Shu Han (c. 200-263), Liu Bei's kingdom in Sichuan during the Three Kingdoms, claiming legitimacy as successor of Han
to send troops
to pacify
Pingding county in Yangquan 陽泉|阳泉[Yang2 quan2], Shanxi
